newCategoryHint: Enter name of the new category
gcdShortDescription: Find the greatest common divisor of two numbers
gcdLongDescription: The greatest common divisor (GCD) of two numbers is the largest number that divides both of them without leaving a remainder.
lcmShortDescription: Find the least common multiple of two numbers
lcmLongDescription: The least common multiple (LCM) of two numbers is the smallest number that is a multiple of both numbers.
rootShortDescription: Find the nth root of a number
rootLongDescription: The root of a number is a value that, when multiplied by itself a certain number of times, gives the original number.
powerShortDescription: Raise a number to a power
powerLongDescription: The power of a number is the number of times the number is multiplied by itself.
versionSecurityPathShortDescription: Check the security patch level of your Android device
versionSecurityPathLongDescription: The Android security patch level is a date that Android device manufacturers release security patches.
unknownOrNotAndroidNotice: We couldn't check that. Make sure you are using an Android device. Your device may not provide this information.
unknownOrNotIosNotice: We couldn't check that. Make sure you are using an iOS device. Your device may not provide this information.
unknownOrNotLinuxNotice: We couldn't check that. Make sure you are using a Linux device. You distribution may not provide this information.
unknownOrNotMacOSNotice: We couldn't check that. Make sure you are using a Mac device. Your device may not provide this information.
unknownOrNotWindowsNotice: We couldn't check that. Make sure you are using a Windows device. Your device may not provide this information.
unknownOrNotWebNotice: We couldn't check that. Make sure you are using a web browser. Your browser may not provide this information.
boardShortDescription: Get the board information of the device
boardLongDescription: The board information provides details about the main circuit board of the device.
deviceLongDescription: The device information includes details about the device model, manufacturer, and other specifications.
hardwareLongDescription: The hardware information provides details about the physical components of the device.
isLowRamDeviceShortDescription: Check if the device is a low RAM device
isLowRamDeviceLongDescription: This checker determines if the device is classified as a low RAM device, which may affect performance.
modelLongDescription: The device model provides the specific model name or number of the device.
supported32BitAbisLongDescription: The supported 32-bit ABIs list the 32-bit Application Binary Interfaces that the device supports.
systemFeaturesLongDescription: The system features provide a list of features supported by the device's operating system.
versionBaseOsLongDescription: The base OS version provides the version of the base operating system running on the device.
versionPreviewSdkIntLongDescription: The preview SDK version provides the version number of the preview SDK installed on the device.
bootloaderLongDescription: The bootloader version provides details about the bootloader software on the device.
displayLongDescription: The display information provides details about the device's screen, including resolution and density.
hostLongDescription: The host information provides details about the host system on which the device is running.
isPhysicalDeviceShortDescription: Check if the device is a physical device
isPhysicalDeviceLongDescription: This checker determines if the device is a physical device or an emulator.
productLongDescription: The product information provides details about the product name and version of the device.
supported64BitAbisLongDescription: The supported 64-bit ABIs list the 64-bit Application Binary Interfaces that the device supports.
tagsLongDescription: The build tags provide additional information about the build of the device's operating system.
versionCodenameLongDescription: The version codename provides the codename of the current operating system version.
versionReleaseLongDescription: The release version provides the version number of the current operating system release.
brandLongDescription: The brand information provides details about the brand or manufacturer of the device.
fingerprintLongDescription: The build fingerprint provides a unique identifier for the build of the device's operating system.
idLongDescription: The build ID provides a unique identifier for the build of the device's operating system.
manufacturerLongDescription: The manufacturer information provides details about the company that manufactured the device.
serialNumberLongDescription: The device serial number provides a unique identifier for the device.
supportedAbisLongDescription: The supported ABIs list the Application Binary Interfaces that the device supports.
typeLongDescription: The build type provides information about the type of build, such as user or userdebug.
versionIncrementalLongDescription: The incremental version provides the incremental version number of the current operating system build.
versionSdkIntLongDescription: The SDK version provides the version number of the Software Development Kit (SDK) used by the operating system.
identifierForVendorLongDescription: The identifier for vendor provides a unique identifier for the device that is consistent across apps from the same vendor.
iosisPhysicalDeviceShortDescription: Check if the device is a physical device
iosisPhysicalDeviceLongDescription: This checker determines if the device is a physical device or an emulator.
iosmodelLongDescription: The device model provides the specific model name or number of the device.
nameLongDescription: The device name provides the name assigned to the device by the user.
systemVersionLongDescription: The system version provides the version number of the operating system running on the device.
utsnameNodenameLongDescription: The UTS name nodename provides the network name of the device.
utsnameSysnameLongDescription: The UTS name sysname provides the name of the operating system.
isIosAppOnMacShortDescription: Check if the app is running on a Mac
isIosAppOnMacLongDescription: This checker determines if the iOS app is running on a Mac.
localizedModelLongDescription: The localized device model provides the model name of the device in the current locale.
modelNameLongDescription: The device model name provides the specific model name of the device.
systemNameLongDescription: The system name provides the name of the operating system running on the device.
utsnameMachineLongDescription: The UTS name machine provides the hardware identifier of the device.
utsnameReleaseLongDescription: The UTS name release provides the release level of the operating system.
utsnameVersionLongDescription: The UTS name version provides the version level of the operating system.
linuxBuildIdLongDescription: The build ID provides a unique identifier for the build of the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxIdLongDescription: The ID provides a unique identifier for the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxIdLikeLongDescription: The ID like provides a list of operating systems that are similar to the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxMachineIdLongDescription: The machine ID provides a unique identifier for the machine running the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxNameLongDescription: The name provides the name of the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxPrettyNameLongDescription: The pretty name provides a user-friendly name for the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxVariantLongDescription: The variant provides the variant name of the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxVariantIdLongDescription: The variant ID provides a unique identifier for the variant of the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxVersionCodenameLongDescription: The version codename provides the codename of the current version of the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxVersionLongDescription: The version provides the version number of the GNU/Linux operating system.
linuxVersionIdLongDescription: The version ID provides a unique identifier for the version of the GNU/Linux operating system.
webAppCodeNameLongDescription: The app code name provides the internal code name of the web application.
webAppNameLongDescription: The app name provides the name of the web application.
webAppVersionLongDescription: The app version provides the version number of the web application.
webBrowserNameLongDescription: The browser name provides the name of the web browser being used.
webDeviceMemoryLongDescription: The device memory provides the amount of memory available on the device.
webHardwareConcurrencyLongDescription: The hardware concurrency provides the number of logical processors available on the device.
webLanguageLongDescription: The language provides the language setting of the web browser.
webLanguagesLongDescription: The languages provide a list of languages supported by the web browser.
webMaxTouchPointsLongDescription: The max touch points provide the maximum number of touch points supported by the device.
webPlatformLongDescription: The platform provides the platform on which the web browser is running.
webProductLongDescription: The product provides the product name of the web browser.
webProductSubLongDescription: The product sub provides additional product information for the web browser.
webUserAgentLongDescription: The user agent provides the user agent string of the web browser.
webVendorLongDescription: The vendor provides the name of the vendor of the web browser.
webVendorSubLongDescription: The vendor sub provides additional vendor information for the web browser.
macOSActiveCPUsShortDescription: Get the number of active CPUs
macOSActiveCPUsLongDescription: The active CPUs information provides the number of active CPUs on the macOS device.
macOSComputerNameLongDescription: The computer name provides the name assigned to the macOS device by the user.
macOSHostNameLongDescription: The host name provides the network name of the macOS device.
macOSMajorVersionLongDescription: The major version provides the major version number of the macOS operating system.
macOSMinorVersionLongDescription: The minor version provides the minor version number of the macOS operating system.
macOSModelNameLongDescription: The model name provides the specific model name of the macOS device.
macOSPatchVersionLongDescription: The patch version provides the patch version number of the macOS operating system.
macOSArchLongDescription: The architecture provides the architecture type of the macOS device.
macOSCpuFrequencyLongDescription: The CPU frequency provides the frequency of the CPU on the macOS device.
macOSKernelVersionLongDescription: The kernel version provides the version number of the kernel running on the macOS device.
macOSMemorySizeLongDescription: The memory size provides the total amount of memory available on the macOS device.
macOSModelLongDescription: The model provides the specific model identifier of the macOS device.
macOSOsReleaseLongDescription: The OS release provides the release version of the macOS operating system.
macOSSystemGuidLongDescription: The system GUID provides the globally unique identifier for the macOS device.
windowsBuildLabLongDescription: The build lab provides the build lab string of the Windows operating system.
windowsDeviceIdLongDescription: The device ID provides a unique identifier for the Windows device.
windowsMajorVersionLongDescription: The major version provides the major version number of the Windows operating system.
windowsProductNameLongDescription: The product name provides the name of the Windows operating system.
windowsServicePackMajorShortDescription: Get the service pack major version
windowsServicePackMajorLongDescription: The service pack major version provides the major version number of the service pack installed on the Windows operating system.
windowsBuildLabExLongDescription: The build lab ex provides the extended build lab string of the Windows operating system.
windowsDigitalProductIdLongDescription: The digital product ID provides the digital product identifier for the Windows operating system.
windowsMinorVersionLongDescription: The minor version provides the minor version number of the Windows operating system.
windowsProductTypeLongDescription: The product type provides the type of the Windows operating system.
windowsServicePackMinorShortDescription: Get the service pack minor version
windowsServicePackMinorLongDescription: The service pack minor version provides the minor version number of the service pack installed on the Windows operating system.
windowsBuildNumberLongDescription: The build number provides the build number of the Windows operating system.
windowsDisplayVersionLongDescription: The display version provides the display version of the Windows operating system.
windowsNumberOfCoresLongDescription: The number of cores provides the number of CPU cores available on the Windows device.
windowsRegisteredOwnerLongDescription: The registered owner provides the name of the registered owner of the Windows operating system.
windowsSuitMaskLongDescription: The suit mask provides the suit mask of the Windows operating system.
windowsComputerNameLongDescription: The computer name provides the name assigned to the Windows device by the user.
windowsEditionIdLongDescription: The edition ID provides the edition identifier of the Windows operating system.
windowsPlatformIdLongDescription: The platform ID provides the platform identifier of the Windows operating system.
windowsReleaseIdLongDescription: The release ID provides the release identifier of the Windows operating system.
windowsSystemMemoryInMegabytesLongDescri: The system memory provides the total amount of memory available on the Windows device in megabytes.
windowsCsdVersionLongDescription: The CSD version provides the Customer Support Diagnostics version of the Windows operating system.
windowsInstallDateLongDescription: The install date provides the date when the Windows operating system was installed.
windowsProductIdLongDescription: The product ID provides the product identifier for the Windows operating system.
windowsReservedLongDescription: The reserved information provides reserved data for the Windows operating system.
windowsUserNameLongDescription: The user name provides the name of the user currently logged into the Windows operating system.
randomLongDescription: Generate a random number between the specified minimum and maximum values. Optionally, set a seed for reproducible results.
randomErrorMessage: Please enter valid minimum and maximum values.
createLocalBackupDesc: Create a local backup of the current settings and data.
importLocalBackupDesc: Import settings and data from a local backup file.
resetSettingsDesc: Reset all settings to their default values. This action cannot be undone.
backupsPageDesc: Manage your local backups or reset settings.
settingsReset: Settings have been reset to default values.
apodShortDescription: View NASA's Astronomy Picture of the Day
apodLongDescription: Displays NASA's Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) with title, description, and media. You can select a date and view the corresponding image or video.
apodVideoNotice: This APOD is a video. Tap below to open it in your browser.
apodapi_keyDesc: You can obtain a free API key from the NASA API portal.
show_descriptionDesc: Set to 'true' to display the explanation of the APOD or 'false' to don't.
epicShortDescription: View NASA EPIC images of Earth
epicLongDescription: Displays images of Earth taken by NASA's Earth Polychromatic Imaging Camera (EPIC) on the DSCOVR satellite. You can select a date and collection to view available images, see their metadata, and download them.
epicNoImages: No EPIC images available for this date and collection. Check earlier dates or change collection.
isPrimePromptLabel: Enter a number to check if it is prime.
isPrimeLongDescription: Check if a given number is a prime number.
isPrimeShortDescription: Check if a number is prime
primeFactorizationLongDescription: Find the prime factors of a given number.
primeFactorizationShortDescription: Find the prime factors of a number
divisorsPromptLabel: Enter a number to find its divisors.
divisorsLongDescription: Find all divisors of a given number.
divisorsShortDescription: Find the divisors of a number
showInPowerFormDesc: Set to 'true' to display the result in power form (e.g., 2^3) or 'false' to display as a list (e.g., 2, 2, 2).
fibonacciPromptLabel: Enter how many Fibonacci numbers to generate and the starting index.
fibonacciLongDescription: Generate a list of Fibonacci numbers from a chosen starting point.
timezonePromptLabel: Select date, time, and timezones to convert.
timezoneLongDescription: Convert date and time between different timezones.
datetimeDifferencePromptLabel: Select two dates and times to calculate the difference.
datetimeDifferenceLongDescription: Calculate the difference between two dates and times.
temperatureUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a temperature value to convert.
temperatureUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert temperature values between Celsius, Fahrenheit, and Kelvin.
lengthUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a length value to convert.
lengthUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert length values between metric and imperial units.
massUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a mass value to convert.
massUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert mass values between metric and imperial units.
timeUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a time value to convert.
timeUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert time values between various time units.
areaUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter an area value to convert.
areaUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert area values between metric and imperial units.
toUnitArea: To unit (e.g., Square Kilometer, Square Mile)
volumeUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a volume value to convert.
volumeUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert volume values between metric and imperial units.
toUnitVolume: To unit (e.g., Cubic meter, Imperial pint)
pressureUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a pressure value to convert.
pressureUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert pressure values between various units.
energyUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter an energy value to convert.
energyUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert energy values between various units.
speedUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a speed value to convert.
speedUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert speed values between various units.
fromUnitSpeed: From unit (e.g., Meter per second, Knot)
toUnitSpeed: To unit (e.g., Kilometer per hour, Mile per hour)
digitalStorageUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter a digital storage value to convert.
digitalStorageUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert digital storage values between various units.
substanceUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter an amount of substance value to convert.
substanceUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert amount of substance values between various units.
angleUnitConvertPromptLabel: Enter an angle value to convert.
angleUnitConvertLongDescription: Convert angle values between various units.
areaOfTriangleLongDescription: Calculate the area of a triangle given its base and height.
areaOfSquareLongDescription: Calculate the area of a square given its side length.
areaOfRectangleLongDescription: Calculate the area of a rectangle given its length and width.
areaOfParallelogramLongDescription: Calculate the area of a parallelogram given its base and height.
areaOfTrapezoidLongDescription: Calculate the area of a trapezoid given its bases and height.
areaOfRhombusLongDescription: Calculate the area of a rhombus given its diagonals.
areaOfCircleLongDescription: Calculate the area of a circle given its radius.
perimeterOfSquareLongDescription: Calculate the perimeter of a square given its side length.
perimeterOfRectangleLongDescription: Calculate the perimeter of a rectangle given its length and width.
perimeterOfParallelogramLongDescription: Calculate the perimeter of a parallelogram given its sides.
perimeterOfRhombusLongDescription: Calculate the perimeter of a rhombus given its side length.
perimeterOfTriangleLongDescription: Calculate the perimeter of a triangle given its three sides.
circumferenceOfCircleLongDescription: Calculate the circumference of a circle given its radius.
birthdayLongDescription: Calculate your age and days to next birthday.
birthdayResult:
You are {years} years old.
There are {days} days remaining to your {nextAge}. birthday.
birthdayToday: Your {years}. birthday is today! Happy Birthday from the app developer!
alreadyAddedMessage: This function is already added to this category. Please choose a different category or function.
